si.title: Former Presidents CBK, Maithripala and Ranil share same stage
body_lines: The 45th National Conference of Chartered Accountants took place yesterday (16) in Colombo, featuring a rare gathering of three former Presidents of Sri Lanka—Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga, Maithripala Sirisena, and Ranil Wickremesinghe—on the same stage.

The former leaders shared their views on the country’s political landscape and answered questions presented to them at the conference, making the event a highlight in the nation’s political discourse.
Speaking during the event, former President Maithripala Sirisena reflected on the political state of the country, emphasizing the need for integrity at all levels of government.

ඔහු මෙසේ පැවසීය: "රටක පාලකයා යහපත් නිසා ප්රගතියක් ලබා ගත නොහැක. අග්රාමාත්යවරයා සහ කැබිනට් මණ්ඩලය ද පිරිසිදු විය යුතුය. There must be no room for corruption and fraud. I don’t like some people blaming politicians that the country has been corrupt for the last 74 years. I completely reject that. It’s not just about blaming politicians.”

"දේශපාලන politicians යන් මුල සිටම ජනාධිපති ලේකම් කාර්යාලයේ ලේකම් කාර්යාලයෙන් පුහුණු කළ යුතුයි. The citizens must also play their part in building a better nation. Now when you go to vote, you can’t work without alcohol. You need a good meal, you need a good bus. That’s the situation”, Sirisena added.
When asked to offer advice to a future president, each former leader shared their thoughts:

Ranil Wickremesinghe spoke on leadership, drawing a comparison between corporate and political leadership. “ Mr. Panditaratne became the President of UNP. He was actually like the right hand of the President. Mahaweli project was successful because of him. If they join the United National Party, these people can go up. ප්රධාන විධායක නිලධාරියෙකුට සහ ජනාධිපතිවරයෙකුට විවිධ භූමිකාවන් ඇත. ස්ටීව් ජොබ්ස් කිසි විටෙකත් එක්සත් ජනපදයේ සභාපතිවරයා විය නොහැක. Only Donald Trump managed to cross that line,” he said.
මෛත්රීපාල සිරිසේන අනාගතය ගැන සුභවාදීව ප්රකාශ කළේය, "ඔබ කිසිවෙකු තවමත් මැතිවරණය සඳහා දුවන්නේ නැත, නමුත් කවදා හෝ ඔබේ වරලත් ගණකාධිකාරීවරයෙක් මේ රටේ ජනාධිපති බවට පත්වනු ඇතැයි මම බලාපොරොත්තු වෙමි."

Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga emphasized the need for educated and capable individuals to enter politics. “Doors should be opened for everyone. Educated and competent people should be encouraged to lead. I am no longer involved in politics but am focused on building new leaders,” she said.

Maithripala Sirisena addressed the issue of corruption within ministries, noting that it is often a collaborative effort. “There are educated individuals who steal. Ministers can’t engage in corruption without the knowledge of ministry secretaries and chief accountants. It becomes a chain reaction, and then they all get involved,” he explained.

When asked about his decision to appoint Mahinda Rajapaksa as Prime Minister during the “Good Governance” government, Sirisena humorously deflected, stating, “I could answer that, but I’m not sure if Mr. Ranil will be pleased. If anyone wants to know, they can ask me privately. It wasn’t solely my decision, but I take responsibility. Being a leader means facing many tough decisions.”

ta.title: Former Presidents CBK, Maithripala and Ranil share same stage
body_lines: The 45th National Conference of Chartered Accountants took place yesterday (16) in Colombo, featuring a rare gathering of three former Presidents of Sri Lanka—Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga, Maithripala Sirisena, and Ranil Wickremesinghe—on the same stage.

முன்னாள் தலைவர்கள் நாட்டின் அரசியல் நிலப்பரப்பில் தங்கள் கருத்துக்களைப் பகிர்ந்துகொண்டு, மாநாட்டில் அவர்களுக்கு வழங்கப்பட்ட கேள்விகளுக்கு பதிலளித்தனர், இது நாட்டின் அரசியல் சொற்பொழிவில் இந்த நிகழ்வை ஒரு சிறப்பம்சமாக மாற்றியது.
Speaking during the event, former President Maithripala Sirisena reflected on the political state of the country, emphasizing the need for integrity at all levels of government.

அவர் குறிப்பிட்டார்: “ஒரு நாடு அதன் ஆட்சியாளர் நன்றாக இருப்பதால் முன்னேற முடியாது. The Prime Minister and the Cabinet must also be clean. There must be no room for corruption and fraud. I don’t like some people blaming politicians that the country has been corrupt for the last 74 years. I completely reject that. It’s not just about blaming politicians.”

“அரசியல்வாதிகளுக்கும் ஆரம்பத்தில் இருந்தே, அமைச்சக செயலாளர் முதல் ஜனாதிபதியின் செயலாளர் வரை பயிற்சி அளிக்கப்பட வேண்டும். The citizens must also play their part in building a better nation. இப்போது நீங்கள் வாக்களிக்கச் செல்லும்போது, ​​ஆல்கஹால் இல்லாமல் வேலை செய்ய முடியாது. You need a good meal, you need a good bus. அதுதான் நிலைமை ”, சிரிசேனா மேலும் கூறினார்.
When asked to offer advice to a future president, each former leader shared their thoughts:

கார்ப்பரேட் மற்றும் அரசியல் தலைமைக்கு இடையே ஒரு ஒப்பீட்டை வரைந்த ரங்கில் விக்ரெமேசிங் தலைமை குறித்து பேசினார். “எம். Panditaratne became the President of UNP. He was actually like the right hand of the President. மஹாவேலி திட்டம் அவர் காரணமாக வெற்றிகரமாக இருந்தது. If they join the United National Party, these people can go up. ஒரு தலைமை நிர்வாக அதிகாரி மற்றும் ஒரு ஜனாதிபதிக்கு வெவ்வேறு பாத்திரங்கள் உள்ளன. Steve Jobs could never be President of the United States. டொனால்ட் டிரம்ப் மட்டுமே அந்தக் கோட்டைக் கடக்க முடிந்தது, ”என்றார்.

Maithripala Sirisena expressed optimism about the future, humorously saying, “None of you have run for election yet, but I hope that someday one of your Chartered Accountants will become the President of this country.”

Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga emphasized the need for educated and capable individuals to enter politics. “அனைவருக்கும் கதவுகள் திறக்கப்பட வேண்டும். படித்த மற்றும் திறமையான நபர்களை வழிநடத்த ஊக்குவிக்க வேண்டும். நான் இனி அரசியலில் ஈடுபடவில்லை, ஆனால் புதிய தலைவர்களை உருவாக்குவதில் கவனம் செலுத்துகிறேன், ”என்று அவர் கூறினார்.

Maithripala Sirisena addressed the issue of corruption within ministries, noting that it is often a collaborative effort. “திருடும் படித்த நபர்கள் உள்ளனர். அமைச்சக செயலாளர்கள் மற்றும் தலைமை கணக்காளர்களின் அறிவு இல்லாமல் அமைச்சர்கள் ஊழலில் ஈடுபட முடியாது. இது ஒரு சங்கிலி எதிர்வினையாக மாறும், பின்னர் அவர்கள் அனைவரும் ஈடுபடுகிறார்கள், ”என்று அவர் விளக்கினார்.

When asked about his decision to appoint Mahinda Rajapaksa as Prime Minister during the “Good Governance” government, Sirisena humorously deflected, stating, “I could answer that, but I’m not sure if Mr. Ranil will be pleased. If anyone wants to know, they can ask me privately. இது எனது முடிவு மட்டுமல்ல, ஆனால் நான் பொறுப்பேற்கிறேன். Being a leader means facing many tough decisions.”
